Digital Price Modelling Analyst

Company Name Correlate Resources Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our client is a market leading e-commerce and online retail business with a well known and instantly recognisable brand. Due to the ongoing success of the organisation a brand new position has been created for a Senior Digital Price Modelling Analyst to join the Sydney based Analytics team. With the key focus of these role to drive the strategic optimisation of revenue generation across its digital channels the core responsibilities of this roles will cover but not be limited to;


  • Develop a series of pricing models to optimise revenue generation across the platform.
  • Develop a deep understanding of customer, advertiser and partnership dynamics to provide a clear narrative on key drivers / anchors and their relative contribution to advertising business performance
  • Partner with BU leaders to tackle strategic challenges and guide strategic response via advanced analytical methods
  • Test and optimise pricing & yield performance across all user touchpoints and platforms
  • Set up and maintain tracking requirements to ensure that complete data sets are available for automated reporting
  • Develop and maintain necessary dashboards and provide the corisponding insight and drive business decisions


As the successful applicant you will come from a strong background working in a data driven insights environment, preferably with an online (digital analytics) focus. You will be able to demonstrate;


  • Strong stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to gather and define requirements, negotiate timelines/deliverables, present analysis, insights & startegic recommendations.
  • Experience delivering analytics and modelling projects such as; Price.Yield Models, Propensity Models, Customer Lifetime Value Analysis, Behavioural Modelling, Attribution Analysis and Customer Segmentation Models will all prove highly advantageous. \xa0
  • Experience working in a Programmatic / Ad-Tech focus environment will prove advantageous
  • Strong SQL programming skills to extract, manage and manipulate complex data sets in preparation for analysis (i.e. SQL Server, Oracle SQL, Teradata SQL, MySQL etc)
  • Technical proficiency with Web and Advertising Analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google DFP, SiteCatalyst (Adobe/ Omniture) would prove highly advantageous.
  • Exposure to R or Python programming along with experience using data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Qlikview will prove highly advantageous.

Premier Support Engineer

Company Name Atlassian Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 31 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description

If you love working with smart teams and are passionate about providing high-quality service to the world's largest customers, then this role could be for you. As a Premier Support Engineer, you are key in providing a consistent quality experience, bringing new and improved support methodologies to Atlassian, and building a wide and committed customer base to the Atlassian products and brand. As part of the team you will receive on-boarding training to make you a specialist in one or many of our products, system technologies, and network technologies.

You will lead and participate in customer facing calls helping to communicate progress updates, action plans, and resolution details. You will be part of a team ensuring we have customers for life. If this sounds interesting to you, apply and become a member of our global team of engineers practicing a follow-the-sun methodology with our other offices around the world to deliver the best support possible for our high-priority customers.

In This Role
    • You will wow our customers and partners by providing quality and timely support
    • You will function as a lead level III support engineer working on our most important customer accounts
    • You will work with other team members in Austin and other Atlassian offices globally
    • You will become one of our team of specialists improving our support capabilities, capacity, and quality for our largest and most sophisticated customers
    • You are going to be a part of our Enterprise Support team that focuses on providing advanced support and product expertise to our largest customers
    • You will perform triage, root cause analysis, debugging and solving problems across one-to-many Atlassian products

On Your First Day, We'll Expect That
    • You have over 3 years of experience in support, software services, and/or system administration for a large end-user community
    • You posses profound knowledge and understanding of operating systems (e.g. Linux, OS X, and/or Windows)
    • You have deep understanding of networks and relevant technologies, including proxies, load balancers, LDAP, Active Directory, SSL, etc.
    • You have an understanding of application server technologies (e.g. Tomcat, Apache, WebSphere, JBoss, etc.)
    • You are an expert in SQL databases

It's Also Great If
    • You have worked with Atlassian products
    • You have experience in administration of clustered/multi-node virtual appliances using VMware products

More About Our Team

The team is filled with customer focused individuals that champion and support industry-leading products that are used by a growing list of 50,000 customers globally. We challenge one another every day and hold ourselves accountable for our work product as well as our customer's overall success. We all enjoy the interactions with the customers, problem-solving, digging into complex issues, and actively championing for customers within Atlassian. We wake up every morning asking ourselves how we can improve the customer's experience, the quality of our product, the benefit of our support system, or our individual weaknesses. We are not scared of challenges, nor do we back down or get deterred by tough problems. When problems seem the hardest we are at our best, we work harder to find the root cause and a solution. We are a combination of passion and persistence. We feel that through our roles we can positively impact millions of end-users and their experience our products. Our team is open, filled with varied backgrounds and talents, respectful, focused, located around the globe, and all about providing legendary service to our customers.

More About Our Benefits

Our offices are open, highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year to support your favourite cause, plenty of food and drinks (including our famous 'Charlie's bar'), ergonomic workstations with sit/stand desks, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and more.

More About Atlassian

Software is changing the world, and we’re at the center of it all. With a customer list that reads like a who's who in tech and a highly disruptive business model, we’re advancing the art of team collaboration with products like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, Trello, and now Stride. Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, we’re out to unleash the potential of every team. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who are powered by passion and eager to do the best work of their lives in a highly autonomous yet collaborative, no B.S. environment.

Additional Information

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

  • Computer Software
  • Internet

Litigation Associate

Company Name Allen & Overy Company Location Sydney, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 57 views

Be an early applicant

Job description






Department Purpose



Throughout our international network, dispute resolution lawyers represent global businesses on litigation, arbitration and mediation matters.

We provide a full and comprehensive service in most of the world's major countries and have dealt with many of the problems generated by changes in the financial marketplace meaning that our network is ideally placed to handle the growing number of cross-border disputes. It is this ability to manage disputes around the world and to coordinate cross-border proceedings that persuades many of our clients to instruct us.

We actively pursue all avenues of dispute resolution available and advise clients on choosing the method most appropriate to them and to a particular matter. Our main priority is to resolve disputes quickly and effectively with as little disruption to business as possible - recognition of this is central to how we approach any matter.

In each situation, our global network means we can deliver accurate, commercial advice quickly, wherever the dispute takes place. If the dispute covers multiple jurisdictions, our local experts on the ground can quickly form an international team. Our lengthy experience means we know what to expect and how to achieve results. We never lose sight of the need to tailor our approach to the needs of the client we are representing, whether they are a large corporate undertaking or a smaller enterprise.

Ranked in Tier 1, Legal 500, 2016, Dispute Resolution - Commercial Litigation
"They are a go-to firm for all aspects of commercial litigation, with a range of excellent lawyers in this field at all levels" Chambers UK 2017

Ranked in Tier 1: "Sources praise the experience of the team, highlighting its commercial outlook as a key strength. 'Their approach is pragmatic and hands-on; they are one of our go-to firms'" Chambers Global 2018, Dispute Resolution




Key relationships

  • The team work closely across both Australian offices as well as with the wider APAC team.
  • You will also work with other departments across the office on occasion.




What we offer

  • We offer you a dynamic work environment and the opportunity to be a part of a leading international law firm.
  • We offer a variety of intellectually exciting work and the opportunity to work with other departments in an interdisciplinary way, both in Sydney and internationally.
  • You will be a part of a dynamic team, closely involved in both cross-departmental and cross-border cases
  • We run national and international secondment programmes to allow our lawyers to work with other departments, other people and to be exposed to the different cultures that the firm encompasses.
  • We offer dedicated local and global training programmes and we also organise professional training on communication, IT skills, management and business development skills.
  • You will have the support of specialised know-how managers and have access to dedicated support staff and support systems.



 Key requirements:

  • Qualified lawyer - minimum of twenty-four months post qualification experience
  • Outstanding academic credentials
  • Training from a top tier law firm with strong litigation and/or arbitration experience
  • Resilient self-starter with the intellectual curiosity and versatility to continuously acquire, build upon and share knowledge
  • Highly motivated team player with excellent organisational skill
  • Clear and concise verbal and written communicator with outstanding interpersonal skills and a good eye for detail
  • Entrepreneurial drive
  • Strong commercial/business acumen Clear understanding of law firm economics and an understanding of the firm's strategic priorities
  • A person of sound judgement and core values, able to establish a high level of credibility

[

Testing & Commissioning Manager

Company Name UGL Company Location City of Parramatta, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

UGL Unipart Rail Services Pty Ltd (UGL Unipart) was founded in December 2011 as a Joint Venture between UGL (Australia) and Unipart Rail (UK). UGL Unipart operates a Rail Maintenance Facility at Auburn where it maintains rolling stock for Sydney Trains, Transport for New South Wales and other rail operators.

UGL Unipart is seeking a Testing & Commissioning Manager to provide governance, engineering expertise and technical service support to operations in respect to railway rolling stock and projects.

Key Tasks And Responsibilities
  • Effectively manage all resources for assigned areas of responsibility ensuring coordination of engineering personnel
  • Constantly review the effectiveness of activities and initiate appropriate action to ensure achievement of agreed standards and targets
  • Ensure that all equipment and facilities are fully and correctly utilized and maintained as applicable
  • Ensure that all safety, quality, engineering and customer requirements and standards are understood and achieved
  • Implement and maintain an effective continuous improvement process
  • Monitor and use data and information provided in performance reports e.g. cycle time, warranty incidents and cost, use of consumables, budget variations etc. to maintain and / or enhance performance standards
  • Develop Change Control and implement liaising with TfNSW, Sydney Trains and Operations personnel
  • Assist with the development of business plans and budgets for areas of responsibility
  • Provide expert engineering and technical services to support the operational area and specifically with regard to CCO engineering and projects
  • Resolve technical problems relating to work scopes and train equipment
  • Manage warranty investigations, preparation reports on outcomes and recommend actions as appropriate
  • Manage preparation and implementation of engineering controlled documents related to the products and services performed within the operational area including: o Contract Change Orders o Engineering Instructions and modifications o Deviations
  • Ensure all documentation complies established engineering standards and ISO9001 requirements
  • Provide expert engineering and technical services to support operational areas with specific regard to mechanical, electrical, structural, pneumatics, bogie and welding engineering
  • Continually monitor the performance of railway rolling stock and identify potential product improvement opportunities and projects in order to increase product reliability, improve safety, minimize environmental impact and reduce customers operational cost.
  • Work with Senior Engineers and customers to determine and implement appropriate specification and work scope changes for improvement in product reliability and cost
  • Assess Safety /Risk of proposed product changes
  • Assist production with the implementation of changed specifications on work scopes
  • Manage special projects including product manufacturing implementation as required
  • Develop and update business procedures / practices and technical management of product improvement projects
  • Engage with accounting systems for monitoring the productivity invoicing
  • Prepare Contract Change Orders and other documentation representing a project with it’s full description, documentation and cost benefit analysis
  • Write, amend, review and approve the content and coverage of controlled documentation such as specifications and engineering instructions
  • Propose creation and/or modification of HSSE documents within the management system and report to Corporate HSSE personnel
  • Ensure compliance with all record keeping requirements
  • Undertake any adhoc projects, initiatives, tasks as direction by the Operations Manager
Team Management & Development Responsibilities
  • Provide leadership, direction, supervision and inspirational management to all team members (direct & indirect).
  • Establish clear communication, solid lines of control and delegation to sub-ordinates and actively create and maintain a culture of openness, responsiveness, honest, ethics and responsibility across the team.
  • Manage the selection and training of all team members, building a high skilled, performance focused, innovative, passionate team.
  • Establish appropriate and effective KPI’s for all direct team members that allow performance to be clearly measured.
  • Conduct Performance Development sessions with all direct reports in line with Company policy including consequence management where required and developmental requirements aligned with succession plans.
  • Coach and mentor all direct reports on all aspects of their role, facilitating effective co-operation and trust, encouraging the free exchange for information, ideas and techniques between the various operations teams, leading and motivating them to be aligned to the same team goals and business objectives.
  • Address poor performance and inappropriate behavior in a timely manner, taking disciplinary action where required within guidelines of UGL policies and procedures.
  • Ensure contractors / suppliers are sourced, assessed, employed, managed and supervised in accordance with UGL’s HSSE and procurement requirements.
  • Ensure communication and consultation, with internal and external parties, of appropriate HSSE information.
  • Review and provide recommendation of business systems requirements to relevant line of business.
Qualifications And Education Requirements
  • Engineering Degree or relevant industry experience
  • Working knowledge of Operational Railway Practices
  • Track Safety Awareness Certificate
  • High degree of computer literacy including spread sheet and database applications
  • Strong project management skills
  • Experience in managing a team of Technical Staff
  • Sound understanding of continuous improvement practices
  • Specification writing skills
  • Effective liaison skills
  • Proven effectiveness in organizing and maintaining information and records
  • Very good oral and written communication skills
  • Working knowledge of SAP
  • Working knowledge of electric passenger rail car systems and technology
  • Knowledge and experience of engineering practices involved in passenger train rolling stock maintenance
  • Working knowledge of Rail Safety Act & OH&S Regulations
  • Strong communication skills (oral & written) including strong negotiation and influencing skills and the ability to establish effective working relationships with a variety of people at different levels both internally and externally.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently to organise and prioritise demands, handle multiple complex tasks simultaneously, set and meet deadlines and follow-through within a fast paced environment with multiple and competing demands.
  • Proficient skills in computers: MS Word, Excel, email.
Desirable/Preferred Skills
  • Experience with 4GT Rollingstock (for example Waratah or Oscar Fleets)
  • Previous Experience with Testing and Commissioning of Rollingstock
  • Experience with Fibre Optic Installations and Fault Finding
  • Must be customer focused, team oriented, accountable and results driven.
  • Must be energetic with a positive can do attitude.
  • Ability and willingness to adapt, quickly learn and put to use new skills and knowledge brought about by rapidly changing structure, process, information and/or technology.
Additional Notes
  • Experienced gained in the rail, automotive, military, defence, avionics or any other safety critical environment.
As a fast growing global, multi-disciplined company, UGL are looking for strong achievers who strive for results and are passionate about developing their expertise.

UGL are looking for people who are professional, innovative, committed and looking to be challenged.

We encourage and promote diversity and inclusion, and welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of gender, age, disability and ethnicity including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

If you are confident, have the skills, knowledge and experience to fulfil this role then please apply now via the button.

886711151:
[

Indigenous Student Success and Support Officer

Company Name University of Southern Queensland Company Location Toowoomba, Queensland, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

The College for Indigenous Studies, Education and Research (CISER) is committed to the quality provision of higher education for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and has an excellent reputation within the Indigenous community for its delivery of quality Indigenous education. You will join a team of dedicated academics and professionals who work hard to constantly improve the quality and relevance of our suite of highly regarded programs.


CISER has a four-pronged focus which includes providing Indigenous courses and programs; engaging in relevant research; managing Indigenous student engagement, retention and graduation; and community engagement.


A rewarding opportunity has become available for an enthusiastic and suitably experienced individual to proactively engage with and provide a wide variety of support to first year Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students, ensuring their academic success.


This is an identified position in line with USQ’s Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples Workforce Strategy 2018-2020 which aims to increase the representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employees in all areas of the University. For this position, it is an equal opportunity measure that applicants must be of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander descent as per section 105 of the Queensland Anti-Discrimination Act (1991).


What you’ll do


As an Indigenous Student Success and Support Officer you will work to ensure that the University’s Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students are provided with timely and effective interventions aimed at enhancing their engagement and retention.


\xa0In particular you will:

  • implement a variety of relationship-building practices with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students to tailor-make individual student support programs, where required, in consultation with the Indigenous Student Liaison team, CISER and discipline specific academic staff;
  • proactively engage with first year students to raise awareness of learning resources, support mechanisms, and provide information pertaining to assessment and examination processes;
  • develop and assist in implementing enhancements to the “Ask Aunty” online Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander student support portal;
  • identify at-risk students through attendance monitoring, assessment submission, Library use and Moodle usage, and make recommendations to academic and support staff, as appropriate, on actions needed to address potential issues;
  • prepare reports for the College and other relevant University committees on issues affecting College students, based on student feedback; and
  • collaborate with other relevant areas of the University, collate and analyse data (such as retention, attrition and grade reports) to identify trends and evaluate the effectiveness of Indigenous student success and support services.


What will help you succeed?


Your success in this pivotal role will rely on your ability to build effective relationships with a diverse range of clients along with your knowledge of local Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture and communities.


Additionally, you will have:

  • a Degree qualification with at least 2 years subsequent relevant work experience in a busy office or frontline service delivery environment, or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training;
  • demonstrated ability to independently apply high quality judgement, interpretation and reasoning, provide accurate and concise information and advice to external and internal clients with a focus on maintaining confidentiality, effective cross-cultural communication and achieving effective customer relationships;

We’re looking for a Wellness-based chiropractor for our Vitalistic Practice!

What could provide this better than a career in Chiropractic?

Job description

Boral leads the Quarry industry with a total commitment to safety, quality and service, as well as a consistent ability to satisfy demanding performance requirements across diverse, complex projects and provides a range of raw materials to support and supply multiple industry segments.


We have proudly been involved in the supply of aggregates, road base and other raw materials to several significant projects in NSW. Some examples include; city redevelopments, residential subdivisions, commercial developments, civil and critical infrastructure projects such as the Pacific Highway upgrades.


To contribute to our continued success, Boral are currently seeking a Sales Account Manager to join the team. Reporting to the Sales Manager, the role will focus on:

  • Promoting a safety first culture
  • Taking an established territory covering the South Coast and Sydney Metro, comprising of various quarry and recycling sites
  • Using your commercial acumen and relationship building skills to achieve portfolio growth
  • Servicing civil engineering, construction, mining, events and local & state government clients, all with exciting projects in the pipeline
  • Identify and secure new business opportunities
  • Build and foster relationships with key customers
  • Always ensuring a positive customer experience


On offer will be a challenging and exciting career with a construction industry leader. This is an opportunity to work in a team environment within an organisation dedicated to the safety of our employees. You will have the full support of a recognised, national leader with a culture that rewards success, encourages autonomy and invests in training.


Some benefits on offer include:

  • Generous salary and a competitive incentive program
  • Tools of the trade including a company car, phone and laptop
  • Quality training and development programs
  • Solid national support structure


Key to your success will be:

  • Commitment and support of safety, contributing to a Zero Harm culture
  • Demonstrated ability to handle competing deadlines
  • Customer centric approach with a desire to drive client engagement and solutions based customer service
  • Able to operate autonomously, have personal drive and be results orientated


The following skills and experience are an added advantage:

  • Have experience in a similar position selling services and solutions into the construction, civil and/or mining or local & state government, or similar markets
  • Proven ability to take ownership and foster commercially strong relationships using excellent communication, engagement and influencing skillsets
  • Experienced with CRM systems


Boral welcomes your application if you are driven to deliver a positive customer experience, enjoy team and client interaction and aspire to succeed within an industry leading organisation. To submit an application, please apply online or visit

As an experienced, advocate this role will be responsible for adding value to Chartered Accountants ANZ by working within the Australian Conduct & Discipline and Professional Standards team.   • Engage with team members to consolidate efficient and effective processes

  • Strong relationship management skills and work in a collaborative team environment
  • Strong influencing and negotiation skills with advanced communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage complex interactions
  • Experience in dispute resolution, litigation, case management, complaints handling, conciliation services, public affairs, professional services industry and business knowledge.

When you join us, you have an opportunity to develop great skills & strong networks and do something different and fresh with your career!

We are committed to achieving a diverse workforce and strongly encourage applications from people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, and people with disabilities. To be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in Australia. We are only able to contact shortlisted candidates at this time.

Sound like you? To apply, please send your resume along with covering letter via the apply button.

Are you an Allied Health Practitioner looking for your next meaningful role?

We know you’re spoilt for choice in this vibrant NDIS marketplace.

Why? Because the NDIS is creating new and better opportunities for consumers to access the quality servicesthey need and service providers need quality people to deliver quality services. It’s that simple.

With many years of service delivery experience, a dynamic team ready for change and market presence in some of Australia’s fastest growing regions, Windermere are in a prime position for NDIS success. We want to share this with you.

Windermere Allied Health Practitioners provide quality evidence-based early childhood intervention services and discipline specific interventions for children and their families. Our Early Childhood Development Service allows for creativity and enterprising practice through our transdisciplinary key worker model in an environment of continuous quality improvement.

We are currently on the lookout for a Speechie, OT, Physio or Psychologist who is:
  • Qualified and professionally registered, with early intervention experience
  • Knowledgeable about the theoretical underpinnings of paediatric practice including typical development and common conditions
  • Confident with the assessment, implementation and evaluation of plans and services for children & families
  • Genuinely passionate about getting in early to make a difference in the lives of our consumers
  • Living and breathing brand ambassadors for Windermere in the NDIS marketplace

  • Be part of something bigger - help us to create a stronger, more connected and supported community.

  • Generous salary packaging - boost your take home pay and save on tax.

Great Benefits And Flexible Working Conditions

We are supportive of family friendly work conditions and offer great incentives and benefits to our team. Read more on our Why Windermere pages.

Our client is a thriving, global pharmaceutical experiencing growth due to its focus on four key therapeutic areas and a portfolio of market leading products as well as an exciting pipeline of new products. Your focus initially in this role will be to work on key projects within a specific therapeutic area. Retail Sales Assistant x3

Company Name Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Retail Sales Assistant is responsible for working as part of the RBGV Shop retail team, promoting the RBGV brand and image and effectively interacting with customers to provide outstanding customer service and maximise sales revenue.

Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria (RBGV)
  • Opportunity to work for an iconic landmark of Victoria
  • Exceptional Retail sales skills required
  • Three positions available
Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria is comprised of two significant sites: Melbourne Gardens, a
world-renowned heritage landscape with a significant state-owned collection and Cranbourne Gardens, a conservation and design site dedicated to Australian flora and fauna, including the internationally award-winning Australian Garden. Together, the two sites provide extraordinary opportunities for community engagement and cultural expression. The Gardens also plays an active role in promoting Melbourne as a resilient city, contributing to social cohesion and enhanced scientific literacy toward our vision of a healthy planet and flourishing local community.

The Retail Sales Assistant is responsible for working as part of the RBGV Shop retail team, promoting the RBGV brand and image and effectively interacting with customers to provide outstanding customer service and maximise sales revenue.

The successful candidate will have proven retail sales experience, demonstrated experience in and knowledge of customer selling techniques and experience in computerised point of sale systems. Ideally, you will also have experience of working within a cultural or tourism-related retail sales environment.

Information About The Three Positions

1x Melbourne Part-time Position
This is a part-time role, working Sunday, Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 9:15am-5:18pm. Your usual place of work will be at Melbourne Gardens, however you may be required to work at Cranbourne Gardens from time to time, so flexibility is required.

1 x Cranbourne Part-time Position
This is a part-time role working Thursday, Friday and Saturday from 1:00pm to 5:00pm. Your usual place of work will be at Cranbourne Gardens however you may be required to work at Melbourne Gardens from time to time, so flexibility is required.

1 x Casual Position - Fixed Term position until June 30th 2019
  • Must be able to work across both Melbourne and Cranbourne locations
Availability across a 7 day roster is required. Shifts are allocated according to the needs of the business. The successful applicant will be allocated shifts at both Melbourne and Cranbourne Gardens so it is expected that the applicant will hold a current Driver's Licence and have their own car.

Full availability is essential during the Christmas and New Year period.

For further detail, please refer to the position description.

For more information and to apply for this role, please visit the Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria's website at http://www.rbg.vic.gov.au/about-us/job-opportunities or http://jobs.careers.vic.gov.au by COB Tuesday 9 October 2018.

Enquiries can be directed by email to Tiffany Hall, Retail Operations Administrator at tiffany.hall@rbg.vic.gov.au.

Applications should address the list of role requirements under the heading “Success Profile” as stated in the position description found under the ‘Attachments' heading on the Victorian Government website.

Applications will only be accepted via the Victorian Government website.

  • Research
  • Government Administration

  • Business Development

PACCAR is a global market leader specialising in the design, manufacture and distribution of premium heavy commercial vehicles Kenworth and DAF, related parts, and financial services via an extensive dealer network throughout Australia.


PACCAR Financial provides financial services for purchasers of PACCAR’s vehicles through an extensive dealer network throughout Australia.


Working for PACCAR Financial\xa0 this position is based in Melbourne.


As a Credit Analyst for PACCAR Financial you will be working to provide thorough analysis and sound credit risk assessment of finance applications.

\xa0

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Preparation, assessment and approval of equipment finance credit applications in accordance with the company's credit policies.
  • Analysing financial statements to identify the key drivers and assess the applicant’s credit worthiness
  • Balancing risk assessments with other commercial considerations.
  • Communicating credit decisions and outcomes in a professional manner.
  • Upholding high standards of compliance and customer service

\xa0

The key skills required for this role include:

  • The ability to work effectively in a busy team environment

  • Excellent interpersonal and time management skills

  • Exceptional analytical ability and commercial acumen.

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you must have:

  • 2+ years’ experience in a similar role within Commercial Equipment Finance.

  • A tertiary qualification in Business/Finance (or related field will be highly regarded).

  • Knowledge of credit and risk management techniques.

  • Intermediate MS Office skills are essential.

\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

You will be a key member of a stable and cooperative team, who support and collaborate with each other. PACCAR Financial offers an attractive salary package including optional salary sacrifice, corporate health plan, tuition reimbursement, career path opportunities and free onsite parking.
